content: used later to attach pompom or button weave in any other loose threads block using your preferred method i typically soak my hats for 15 minutes in warm water and spin it on gentle in my washing machine i then stretch the hat over a suitably sized mixing bowl being sure that the ribbing curls underneath the bowl and is not stretched i let the hat get about 80% dry and then take it off the bowl and lie it flat on a towel to dry fully if you want to add a pompon you may make your own extra yarn will be required or purchase one or use a decorative button as pictured attach at top center hole using method of your choice this should be your last step and done after blocking abbreviations dpn - set of 4 double pointed needles mc main color yarn cc contrasting color yarn st or sts stitch es k- knit p purl bor beginning of row marker should be a different color than decrease markers sm slip marker kf/b in a single st knit 1 stitch in front and then a second in back of stitch increasing 1 st to 2 st k2tog knit 2 stitches together ssk slip 1 st then slip the next st insert left needle into the front loops of the slipped sts and knit them together all efforts were made to make this pattern error-free 2024kristina k miller intended for individual home use only not to be reproduced or reknit for profit checkerboard toque size adult large/xl the crown decrease is a bit more challenging in this size but just as pretty designed by kristina k miller revised january 7 2025 materials  165 yards total divided between 2 skeins of medium weight worsted weight #4 yarn in color s of your choice photo samples made with lion brand wool-ease 3 oz 197 yard skeins in colors oxford grey 152 and wheat 402  circular needles #5 3 75mm in 24 length or less circular and double pointed needles dpn size #8 5 0mm  knitting needle markers in 2 colors to mark beginning of rounds and decrease sequence and row counter  optional pompom maker or faux fur pompom a button is also a nice finishing touch gauge on #8 needles in unblocked stockinette pattern 18 st = 4 24 row = 4 gauge on #8 in checkerboard pattern 24 st = 4 22 row = 4 glossary for abbreviations at end of pattern the pattern is worked in the round from bottom to top ribbing with the mc yarn provisionally cast on 96 sts using method of your choice my favorite is https //www youtube com/watch v=3ogg0aij3xe using smaller circular needle #5 knit one row being careful not to twist stitches place marker for beginning of row bor and then join to knit in the round next row begin ribbing pattern using *k2 p1* around for 3 75 -4 joining folded brim place the 96
